tour_name: Hokkaido Winter Wonderland & Hot Springs Retreat

sections.title: Sapporo & Otaru: A Romantic Hokkaido Welcome
sections.content: Your Hokkaido honeymoon begins in Sapporo, the vibrant capital. Explore iconic landmarks like the Sapporo Clock Tower and Odori Park, hand-in-hand through the snow-dusted landscapes. Indulge in Sapporo's legendary ramen at a carefully selected, intimate eatery. Journey to Otaru, a charming port city, where you'll wander along the historic canal, admiring the reflections on the water, and discover exquisite glasswork boutiques. Enjoy a gourmet seafood lunch, showcasing the region's bounty. Conclude these days at Lake Toya, nestled within Toya National Park, with a stay at a serene onsen resort offering breathtaking views and private hot spring baths. This marks the start of your extraordinary journey.

sections.title: Hakodate's History & Asahikawa's Wildlife Wonders
sections.content: Today, you'll travel to Hakodate, a city steeped in history and romantic charm. As evening falls, ascend Mt. Hakodate for a panoramic night view, a truly unforgettable experience. In the morning, immerse yourselves in the Hakodate Morning Market, savoring the freshest seafood delicacies. Then, venture to Asahikawa, home to the world-renowned Asahiyama Zoo. Witness the enchanting penguin walks during winter and marvel at the zoo's innovative animal enclosures, designed to showcase their natural behaviors. Conclude the day with a delicious tasting menu featuring local delicacies and sake.

sections.title: Aomori's Culture & Tohoku's Tranquility
sections.content: Embark on a journey to Aomori, a region rich in cultural heritage. Take a leisurely stroll along the Oirase Stream, surrounded by lush greenery and cascading waterfalls - a serene escape. Continue to Iwate, where you'll explore the majestic Chusonji Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, experiencing the spiritual heart of Tohoku. Conclude your honeymoon with a relaxing train ride through the picturesque countryside, enjoying the tranquil scenery. Savour the culinary delights of the region, including a memorable farewell dinner at a Michelin-star restaurant, celebrating your journey through Hokkaido and Tohoku.
